content.webTitle: Tadic alleges revival  of political violence

fields.headline: Tadic alleges revival  of political violence
fields.bodyText: Serbia's pro-western president yesterday accused the Balkan republic's conservative government of betraying the ideals of the uprising that led to the ousting of president Slobodan Milosevic five years ago. Boris Tadic wrote in Politika daily that the coalition cabinet of prime minister Vojislav Kostunica was reviving "political violence" and "persecution of opponents" similar to that which existed during Milosevic's. Mr Tadic's criticism illustrates the deep divisions that prevail among leaders of the anti-Milosevic coalition after the former president was toppled on October 5 2000.
